column4: Apple's rivals hope its Watch will boost their own wearable tech

column4: Golar LNG and Rosneft to work on floating LNG production
column5: MILAN  March 5 Norwegian shipping company Golar LNG and Russian oil giant Rosneft have signed a preliminary agreement to develop floating liquefied natural gas (LNG) plants in Latin America and potentially elsewhere  Golar said on Thursday.

column4: Mubadala GE Capital 2014 net profit dips 3.9 pct on fee income
column5: DUBAI  March 5 Mubadala GE Capital  a joint venture between the Abu Dhabi state-owned fund and General Electric  reported a 3.9 percent drop in 2014 net profit as higher proceeds from the sale of financial assets could not offset a slump in fee income.

column4: Two GM workers sue carmaker for not allowing unpaid religious days
column5: DETROIT Two General Motors Co workers at its Arlington  Texas  assembly plant have sued the No. 1 U.S. automaker and are seeking class-action status  claiming the company violated the Civil Rights Act of 1964 by denying them unpaid religious days off.

column4: UPDATE 1-Brazil auto output stagnates in February  sales tumble
column5: SAO PAULO  March 5 Auto production in Brazil stagnated in February and sales continued to tumble as carmakers got off to their weakest start in at least five years  deepening the crisis in an industry that is shedding jobs and stressing trade relations.

column4: South Africa's Aspen first-half earnings up 22 percent as acquisitions kick-in
column5: JOHANNESBURG Africa's biggest generic drugmaker Aspen Pharmacare Holdings Ltd  reported a 22 percent increase in half-year profit on Thursday as contributions from recent acquisitions offset the impact of unfavorable currency moves.

column4: BRIEF-TPG  Goldman Sachs to sell shares in nappy group Ontex - bookrunner
column5: * TPG  Goldman Sachs launch sale of 15.6 mln shares in Belgian nappy maker Ontex Group - bookrunners

column4: HKBN IPO priced at top of range as CVC  GIC  Carlyle raise $710 million
column5: HONG KONG Private equity firm CVC Capital Partners [CVC.UL]  a unit of Carlyle Group LP  and Singapore's sovereign wealth fund GIC [GIC.UL] raised a combined $710 million after Hong Kong's second-largest broadband Internet provider  HKBN Ltd   priced its IPO at the top of expectations  people familiar with the deal said on Thursday.

column4: Lawmaker becomes first Republican to enter California's U.S. Senate race
column5: SACRAMENTO  Calif. California state lawmaker Rocky Chavez on Thursday became the first Republican to jump into the race for the U.S. Senate seat being vacated next year by Democrat Barbara Boxer.

column4: Huawei  Intel expand tie-up amid China's rising scrutiny of U.S. tech firms
column5: BEIJING  March 5 China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd and Intel Corp are expanding an existing alliance to provide cloud computing to global telecoms carriers  as U.S. tech firms vie for Chinese tie-ups to retain access to a tough mainland market.

column4: Spanish prosecutor seeks extradition of JPMorgan 'London Whale' supervisor
column5: MADRID A Spanish prosecutor has recommended extradition to the United States of Javier Martin-Artajo  an ex-JPMorgan Chase & Co executive indicted over the "London Whale" scandal which led to over $6.2 billion in trading losses at the bank in 2012. | Video

column4: Spanish prosecutor seeks extradition of JPMorgan 'London Whale' supervisor
column5: MADRID A Spanish prosecutor has recommended extradition to the United States of Javier Martin-Artajo  an ex-JPMorgan Chase & Co executive indicted over the "London Whale" scandal which led to over $6.2 billion in trading losses at the bank in 2012.

column4: Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $5.7 million in California mesh trial
column5: A California jury on Thursday ordered Johnson & Johnson's Ethicon Inc unit to pay $5.7 million in the first trial over injuries blamed on the TVT Abbrevo  one of numerous transvaginal mesh products that are the subject of thousands of lawsuits.

column4: CBRE seeks to buy Johnson Controls' workplace solutions: sources
column5: CBRE Group Inc   the world's largest commercial real estate services firm  is in talks to acquire Johnson Controls Inc's  global workplace solutions business for more than $1 billion  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: CBRE seeks to buy Johnson Controls' workplace solutions -sources
column5: March 5 CBRE Group Inc  the world's largest commercial real estate services firm  is in talks to acquire Johnson Controls Inc's global workplace solutions business for more than $1 billion  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: UPDATE 1-Kroger forecast beats  helped by mergers  fuel margins
column5: March 5 Kroger Co  the biggest U.S. supermarket operator  forecast a full-year profit above analysts' estimates as it benefits from its acquisition of Harris Teeter Supermarkets Inc and higher margins on fuel.

column4: Supermarket operator Kroger's profit rises 23 pct
column5: March 5 Kroger Co  the biggest U.S. supermarket operator  on Thursday reported a 23 percent rise in quarterly profit  helped by its acquisition of Harris Teeter Supermarkets Inc and higher margins on fuel.

column4: Fitch Affirms Leucadia's Long-Term IDR at 'BBB-'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  March 05 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Leucadia National  Corporation's (Leucadia) long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) at 'BBB-'. The  Rating Outlook remains Stable. See the full list of ratings at the end of this  rating action commentary. The ratings of Leucadia and its main operating subsidiary  Jefferies Group LLC  (Jefferies)  continue to be equalized  as Fitch considers Jefferies a core  subsidiary of Leucadia. Th

column4: TSB CEO Pester paid $2.9 million last year
column5: LONDON  March 5 New British bank TSB  paid Chief Executive Paul Pester 1.89 million pounds ($2.9 million) for 2014  a year in which the business listed on the London Stock Exchange.

column4: U.S. considering possible Middle East missile defense -general
column5: WASHINGTON  March 4 The U.S. military is considering sending its THAAD missile defense system to the Middle East  a senior U.S. Army general said on Wednesday  citing what he called an urgent need to respond to foes with missile systems and the will to use them.

column4: Lumber Liquidators faces class-action lawsuit in Florida
column5: MIAMI A $5 million class-action lawsuit filed this week in Florida accuses hardwood and laminate flooring giant Lumber Liquidators  Inc of selling products laden with cancer-causing chemicals.

column4: Lumber Liquidators faces class-action lawsuit in Florida
column5: MIAMI A $5 million class-action lawsuit filed this week in Florida accuses hardwood and laminate flooring giant Lumber Liquidators  Inc of selling products laden with cancer-causing chemicals.

column5: MIAMI  March 5 A $5 million class-action lawsuit filed this week in Florida accuses hardwood and laminate flooring giant Lumber Liquidators  Inc of selling products laden with cancer-causing chemicals.

column4: Mallinckrodt buys respiratory drug maker to boost hospital presence
column5: Dublin-based drugmaker Mallinckrodt Plc strengthened its presence in U.S. hospitals as it agreed to buy privately held Ikaria Inc  a maker of a respiratory drug and its delivery system  for $2.3 billion.

column4: UPDATE 2-Mallinckrodt buys respiratory drug maker to boost hospital presence
column5: * Ikeria owns only approved hypoxic respiratory failure treatment

column4: Mallinckrodt to buy private respiratory drug & device maker for $2.3 bln
column5: March 5 Mallinckrodt Plc said it would buy privately held Ikaria Inc  a maker of a respiratory drug and its delivery system  for $2.3 billion to expand its current offering of specialty products and critical care treatments.

column4: MOVES-Mercer names leader for fiduciary management  growth markets
column5: March 5 Mercer  a unit of Marsh & McLennan Cos   appointed Amit Popat as leader for fiduciary management  growth markets.

column4: McDonald's antibiotic-free move could prompt U.S. chicken squeeze
column5: A plan by McDonald's Corp to phase out chicken raised with certain kinds of antibiotics at its 14 000 U.S. restaurants will put additional pressure on an already-stressed supply chain.

column4: REFILE-McDonald's antibiotic-free move could prompt U.S. chicken squeeze
column5: March 4 A plan by McDonald's Corp to phase out chicken raised with certain kinds of antibiotics at its 14 000 U.S. restaurants will put additional pressure on an already-stressed supply chain.

column4: Guinea to start final trials of Ebola vaccines this week
column5: LONDON/GENEVA Final stage trials of an Ebola vaccine being developed by Merck and NewLink Genetics will begin in Guinea on March 7  the World Health Organization said on Thursday.

column5: * WHO says effective Ebola shot could be a "game-changer"   (Adds details of "ring vaccination" plans  quotes)

column4: Merck-NewLink Ebola vaccine Phase III trial to start March 7
column5: GENEVA  March 5 Merck & Co and NewLink Genetics Corp's Ebola vaccine will begin a Phase III trial in Guinea on March 7  the final stage of testing  the World Health Organization said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Britain ready to force sale of oligarch Fridman's N.Sea assets -PM spokesman
column5: LONDON  March 5 Britain is ready to force the sale of Russian oligarch Mikhail Fridman's recently acquired North Sea energy assets unless it receives unspecified assurances within the next week  Prime Minister David Cameron's spokesman said on Thursday.

column4: The new 'Horsemen of the Nasdaq' - how long will they ride?
column5: NEW YORK Will the tech leaders of today be the has-beens of tomorrow?

column4: Adidas expects sales and profit growth as golf unit recovers
column5: BERLIN  March 5 German sportswear company Adidas  expects robust sales growth in 2015 as its golf business improves and consumer confidence recovers  while net profit should rise faster still despite currency impacts and higher marketing spending.

column4: Peru indigenous groups settle U.S. court claims with Occidental
column5: LIMA Indigenous villagers in Peru have reached a negotiated settlement with Occidental Petroleum Corp  which they had sued for allegedly polluting their lands over three decades  the two sides said on Thursday.

column4: Peru indigenous groups settle U.S. court claims with Occidental
column5: LIMA Indigenous villagers in Peru have reached a negotiated settlement with Occidental Petroleum Corp  which they had sued for allegedly polluting their lands over three decades  the two sides said on Thursday.

column4: Peru indigenous groups settle U.S. court claims with Occidental
column5: LIMA  March 5 Indigenous villagers in Peru have reached a negotiated settlement with Occidental Petroleum Corp   which they had sued for allegedly polluting their lands over three decades  the two sides said on Thursday.

column4: U.S. investor sues OAS  Brazil builder tied to Petrobras scandal
column5: SAO PAULO U.S. investment firm Huxley Capital Corp filed a lawsuit on Thursday in a New York court against Brazilian construction group OAS SA  alleging the debt-ladden company is hiding assets from creditors at two valuable subsidiaries.

column4: U.S. investor sues OAS  Brazil builder tied to Petrobras scandal
column5: SAO PAULO  March 5 U.S. investment firm Huxley Capital Corp filed a lawsuit on Thursday in a New York court against Brazilian construction group OAS SA  alleging the debt-ladden company is hiding assets from creditors at two valuable subsidiaries.

column4: Brazil's elite in crosshairs as Petrobras scandal widens
column5: BRASILIA/SAO PAULO  March 5 A corruption scandal at state-run oil company Petrobras has entered a volatile new phase that could lead to jail for some of Brazil's best-known politicians and business leaders while making a likely recession even worse.

column4: Petrobras downgrade so far 'well-absorbed' by markets  BofA says
column5: SAO PAULO The decision by Moody's Investors Service to cut Petróleo Brasileiro SA's ratings to "junk" last week has so far triggered a mild selloff  as bonds of the world's most indebted oil company remain in most major investment-grade debt indexes  analysts at Bank of America Merrill Lynch said on Thursday.

column4: Brazil woes cast shadow on LatAm corp bond issuance
column5: NEW YORK  March 5 (IFR) - With the corruption scandal surrounding Petrobras effectively shutting Brazilian corporates out of the bond markets  bankers say it will be a while before LatAm issuance regains momentum.

column4: Brazil Petrobras corruption hearing opens with shouting match
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO The opening of a Brazilian congressional probe into alleged corruption at state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA erupted into a shouting match on Thursday when lawmakers rushed the dais and accused the probe's leader of seeking to manipulate the outcome.

column4: Brazil Petrobras corruption hearing opens with shouting match
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  March 5 The opening of a Brazilian congressional probe into alleged corruption at state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA erupted into a shouting match on Thursday when lawmakers rushed the dais and accused the probe's leader of seeking to manipulate the outcome.

column4: Petrobras board OKs plan to seek financing of up to $19.1 bln
column5: SAO PAULO  March 5 Brazil's state-run oil company Petrobras said on Thursday its board of directors had approved plans to seek financing of up to $19.1 billion in 2015 for investment and other projects.

column4: UPDATE 1-Market Chatter-Corporate finance press digest
column5: March 5 The following corporate finance-related stories were reported by media:

column4: Fitch Rates Quest Diagnostics' Bond Offering 'BBB'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  March 05 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'BBB' rating to the $1.2  billion bond offering by Quest Diagnostics Inc. (Quest; NYSE: DGX). The Rating  Outlook is Stable. A full list of ratings follows at the end of this release. Fitch expects the bond proceeds  as well as internal liquidity sources  to be  used to repay up to $1 275 million of outstanding debt and associated fees  during 2015  including: --$500 million of 5.45

column4: Rio Tinto to slim workforce as it battles weak metal prices
column5: LONDON Global mining firm Rio Tinto plans to cut costs and jobs across six divisions  sources said this week  as the company battles a slump in world commodity prices.

column4: Britain's FTSE steadies near record high  Aviva gains
column5: LONDON  March 5 Britain's top share index steadied near a record high on Thursday  with a rally in insurers after positive results offsetting weakness in companies trading without the attraction of their latest dividend payout.

column4: UPDATE 1-Japanese aluminium buyer secures lower $380 premium in Q2 -source
column5: TOKYO  March 5 A major Japanese aluminium buyer has agreed to pay a producer premium of $380 per tonne for metal to be shipped in the April-June period  down from the previous quarter  a buyer source directly involved in the quarterly pricing talks said.

column4: Sun Life forecasts medium-term annual profit growth of 8-10 pct
column5: March 5 Canadian insurer Sun Life Financial Inc   said it expects annual medium-term earnings growth of 8 percent to 10 percent on a per share basis.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Target to cut thousands of jobs as seeks to cut costs by $2 bln
column5: March 3 U.S. retailer Target Corp  which has been battling back after a massive data breach and sluggish performance  on Tuesday said it will eliminate several thousand jobs  mainly from headquarters locations in the United States and India  as it aims to cut $2 billion in costs over two years.

column4: Blackstone eyes opportunities in African power shortages
column5: DAKAR Private equity will play a key role in developing Africa given the massive needs for capital on the continent  says Blackstone Group   which is focusing on infrastructure projects involving power generation and transmission.

column4: Exclusive: Blackstone seeks sale of AlliedBarton Security Services - sources
column5: Blackstone Group LP  is exploring a sale of AlliedBarton Security Services in a deal that could value the largest U.S. security officer services company at around $1.5 billion  including debt  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: RPT-United Airlines may look to hedge fuel two years out
column5: March 4 United Continental Holdings Inc  is looking to lock in its fuel costs with new hedges that could last as long as two years  but first it would like to see oil prices stabilize  Chief Financial Officer John Rainey said in an interview.

column4: UPDATE 2-Kloeckner & Co sees higher 2015 core profit despite tough Q1
column5: FRANKFURT  March 5 German steel distributor Kloeckner & Co said it saw core profit rising in 2015 thanks to restructuring and possible acquisitions  even after an expected tough first-quarter afflicted by steep declines in U.S. steel prices.

column4: Fitch Rates Whirlpool's Proposed Euro 500MM Sr. Unsecured Notes Offering 'BBB'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  March 05 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'BBB' rating to  Whirlpool Corporation's (NYSE: WHR) proposed offering of Euro 500 million  aggregate amount of senior unsecured notes. The new offering will be equal in  right of payment with all other senior unsecured debt. Whirlpool intends to use  the proceeds from the notes offering for the repayment of a portion of its  commercial paper (CP) borrowings.  INDESIT AND HEFEI ACQ
